item.title: [140] AI Pokemon Thread /NAPT/ Thread 176: Cold, Cruel Fate Edition
item.description:
This is a general thread for people to post their AI art, and make requests from others who may want to attempt making their own Pokemon related gens.

NovelAI is a paid AI generator. Opus tier users have "unlimited" Small/Normal generations, though editing tools require credits.

Microsoft's Bing AI is a free image generator that is powered by DALL¬∑E 3.

Civitai is free using its ‚Äòbuzz‚Äô currency. You get about 50 every day plus more for liking models and gens.
>civitai.com

Otaiku is a (mostly) free mobile app. An ad watch is required between each image generation unless you pay.
>ailla.biz/otaiku

Tensor is free to use as well, although you are limited to how many gens you can make per day.
>https://tensor.art/

Local Generation using Stable Diffusion requires a decent video card. Guides for local genning can be found in the /g/ threads:
>>>/g/sdg
>>>/g/ldg
Other Stable Diffusion threads are on: /h/, /e/, /d/, /b/, /vt/, /aco/, /trash/

Hailuo AI takes uploaded art and animates them based on the prompts you get. You get a 3-day free trial, followed by roughly 3 free gens a day afterward. Subscription plans are available.
>https://hailuoai.video/

Pastebin of Pokemon artists:
>https://pastebin.com/U0mmK3Tm (embed)

Characters with under 300 images will require more tags to have them look correct. This is a list of all Pokemon characters with over 300 images:
>https://danbooru.donmai.us/posts?tags=*_%28pokemon%29+&z=5

If you plan on sharing multiple images together, we'd recommend posting just one, and give links for the rest. This way we can conserve space.

This is a locally run html tool provided by ThatOneAiAnon. It keeps track of all artists you like and turns Danbooru's entire tag system in a collapsible list of buttons. You can edit all the js, css, html code to modify the tool. (Ask him for updated versions or more Nai4 tools)
>mega .nz/file/67xwTRSB#m0fPUmJRaWd3oh47gt6nw2LKNMe820TaiKdXTAhx8tI

Previous Thread: >>57694696

Original filename: Articuno.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 49] U.S. tariffs to heavily impact HDD and SSD manufacturers, increasing costs
item.description:
>Seagate's HDD operation involves product development in the U.S. and Singapore; head manufacturing in the United States and Northern Ireland; substrate production in Malaysia; media fabrication in Singapore or Japan (when Seagate sourced platters from Showa Denko); and drive and subassembly manufacturing in China and Thailand.

>Western Digital develops its HDDs in the U.S. and Japan. Media substrates are produced in Malaysia, but the actual media manufacturing occurs in China or Japan (when Western Digital sources from Showa). Head wafers are processed in the U.S., but the final head-gimbal assembly takes place in the Philippines and Thailand. Actual HDDs are built in Malaysia and Thailand.

Original filename: 1719496559265730.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 41] Americans realize they voted against their own interests.
item.description:
Donald Trump Suffers Quadruple Approval Rating Blow
Published Apr 10, 2025 at 12:34 PM EDT

https://www.newsweek.com/donald-trump-approval-rating-polls-2058045

In a significant setback for President Donald Trump, new polling data reveals a sharp decline in his approval ratings.

Why It Matters
Trump's approval rating is a key indicator of his political strength as he navigates his second presidential term and prepares for future policy battles.

A shift in his numbers could influence support from Republican lawmakers, affect his ability to push through his agenda and shape the political landscape heading into the midterm election cycle in 2026.

item.title: [ 99] Trump announces 90-day pause on ‚Äòreciprocal‚Äô tariffs with exception of China
item.description:
https://www.cnn.com/2025/04/09/business/reciprocal-tariff-pause-trump/index.html
President Donald Trump announced a complete pause on all the ‚Äúreciprocal‚Äù tariffs that went into effect at midnight, with the exception of China.

Tariffs on China will be increased to 125% from 104%, he said.

Trump in a Truth Social post Wednesday said he has ‚Äúauthorized a 90 day PAUSE, and a substantially lowered Reciprocal Tariff during this period, of 10%, also effective immediately.‚Äù

‚ÄúBased on the lack of respect that China has shown to the World‚Äôs Markets, I am hereby raising the Tariff charged to China by the United States of America to 125%, effective immediately,‚Äù Trump said in his social media post. ‚ÄúAt some point, hopefully in the near future, China will realize that the days of ripping off the U.S.A., and other Countries, is no longer sustainable or acceptable,‚Äù he wrote.

Stocks rocketed higher on the news, with the Dow surging 2,200 points, or 5.9%. The S&P 500 rose 6.5% and the Nasdaq was more than 8% higher.

Trump, however, did not indicate he was pausing the 10% universal tariff on all trading partners, with the exception of Canada and Mexico, that went into effect over the weekend. Therefore, countries that were subjects of reciprocal tariffs will continue to have a 10% tariff levied on them.

item.title: [110] La Schiava
item.description:
Anyone read this?
La Schiava is a 52-issue Italian comic about Zeudia, the titular slave who's transported from Africa to Louisiana fighting for her freedom.
She's naked on most covers, which just makes me imagine a runaway slave trotting the globe without ever getting clothes. Dunno how accurate that is.

item.title: [ 43] Vietnam Beach Vacation
item.description:
I've got my destinations narrowed down to
>Da Nang
>Quy Nhon
>Nha Trang
>Phu Quoc
I think I'll probably just get a nice hotel near the beach in Da Nang and Nha Trang for 1 month each, but any other suggestions, thoughts, unexpected implications? People say Nha Trang is uneventful but I booked a really nice place really cheap there and it looks like the kind of place I can get good access to beaches, city and nature so it looks good to me.

item.title: [163] /out/ings with a pipe
item.description:
Old thread: >>2774508

This is a thread for enjoying a pipe while doing outdoor activities. If you ask why this belongs on /out/, you've never spent an evening by the campfire with a pipe silently enjoying the nature around you, and you're missing out.

>how to get started
Purchase a Missouri Meerschaum Legend and a pouch of Half and Half or Captain Black tobacco, available at most smoke shops. You will need a lighter or match, and something to tamp it with--a large nail works well if you don't have a pipe tool. Fill the pipe with tobacco, pack it down halfway, top it off, pack it down to 3/4, top it off again, pack gently and enjoy. Smoke slower than you think you need to, the tobacco tastes best when it is burning cool. Tamp and re-light as needed. If you still have trouble, try different methods on YouTube until you find one that works for you.

>smoking a pipe will give you cancer
While any tobacco consumption comes with some risk, the cancer risks from occasional pipe use are pretty minimal. Educate yourself and make your own informed health decisions. Some info here https://aacrjournals.org/cancerpreventionresearch/article/10/12/704/46541/Association-between-Cigar-or-Pipe-Smoking-and

>muh weed
Not the time or place. Start your own thread

>I DON‚ÄôT LIKE WHAT YOU LIKE REEEEEE
Then leave the thread. Pipes have been a part of outdoors culture for centuries. If you don‚Äôt like it, leave.
